trans-unit.source: MySQL Database on Azure supports slave server mode and standard MySQL data replication.
trans-unit.target: MySQL Database on Azure supports slave server mode and standard MySQL data replication.

trans-unit.source: You can use this feature to automatically sync database data from a MySQL server running locally or in other locations, to a server running on MySQL Database on Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can use this feature to automatically sync database data from a MySQL server running locally or in other locations, to a server running on MySQL Database on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that the system variable lower_case_table_names on the master MySQL server is set to 1.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that the system variable lower_case_table_names on the master MySQL server is set to 1.

trans-unit.source: If this is not the case, then you must set it to 1.
trans-unit.target: If this is not the case, then you must set it to 1.

trans-unit.source: This is because MySQL database replication requires the value of this parameter to be consistent between the master and slave servers, and this parameter is set to 1 on MySQL On Azure.
trans-unit.target: This is because MySQL database replication requires the value of this parameter to be consistent between the master and slave servers, and this parameter is set to 1 on MySQL On Azure.

trans-unit.source: mysql> SET GLOBAL lower_case_table_names = 1;
trans-unit.target: mysql> SET GLOBAL lower_case_table_names = 1;

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] **Note: Once the replication role of the MySQL server is set to slave server, the server will be in read-only mode. - Once the replication role of the MySQL server is set to slave server, none of the master server parameters on the replication page will be editable, except for the role. If there is an input error, you must set the replication role to disabled and then reconfigure the slave server parameters. - We recommend setting the binlog_format for the master server to Mixed or Row, in order to avoid causing data replication errors due to the use of unsafe statements such as sysdate ().**

trans-unit.source: Data replication restrictions
trans-unit.target: Data replication restrictions

trans-unit.source: Changes on the master server to accounts and permissions are not replicated.
trans-unit.target: Changes on the master server to accounts and permissions are not replicated.

trans-unit.source: If you created an account on the master server and this account needs to access the slave server, then you will need to create the same account yourself on MySQL Database on Azure.
trans-unit.target: If you created an account on the master server and this account needs to access the slave server, then you will need to create the same account yourself on MySQL Database on Azure.

trans-unit.source: The master and slave server versions must be the same.
trans-unit.target: The master and slave server versions must be the same.

trans-unit.source: For example, both must be MySQL 5.5, or both must be MySQL 5.6.
trans-unit.target: For example, both must be MySQL 5.5, or both must be MySQL 5.6.

trans-unit.source: Solving data replication errors
trans-unit.target: Solving data replication errors

trans-unit.source: If replication stops because it encounters a problem of any kind, the replication status will change to “replication error.”
trans-unit.target: If replication stops because it encounters a problem of any kind, the replication status will change to “replication error.”

trans-unit.source: You can find details of the error by looking at the replication error field.
trans-unit.target: You can find details of the error by looking at the replication error field.

trans-unit.source: Common causes of replication errors include: The value of the max_allowed_packet parameter on the slave server being less than the value of the same parameter on the master server.
trans-unit.target: Common causes of replication errors include: The value of the max_allowed_packet parameter on the slave server being less than the value of the same parameter on the master server.

trans-unit.source: This parameter determines the maximum permitted DML size for MySQL servers.
trans-unit.target: This parameter determines the maximum permitted DML size for MySQL servers.

trans-unit.source: If the value of the parameter is smaller on the slave server than on the master server, some DMLs may run successfully on the master side, but fail to run on the slave server, causing an error.
trans-unit.target: If the value of the parameter is smaller on the slave server than on the master server, some DMLs may run successfully on the master side, but fail to run on the slave server, causing an error.

trans-unit.source: Please ensure that the max_allowed_packet values are consistent between the master and slave servers.
trans-unit.target: Please ensure that the max_allowed_packet values are consistent between the master and slave servers.

trans-unit.source: When the replication role is changed to slave server, there is a master server parameter input error.
trans-unit.target: When the replication role is changed to slave server, there is a master server parameter input error.

trans-unit.source: This makes it impossible for the slave server to connect to the master server.
trans-unit.target: This makes it impossible for the slave server to connect to the master server.

trans-unit.source: Data is consistent between the master and slave servers.
trans-unit.target: Data is consistent between the master and slave servers.

trans-unit.source: For example, replication attempts to insert a record into the slave server that already exists.
trans-unit.target: For example, replication attempts to insert a record into the slave server that already exists.

trans-unit.source: There are several possible causes of this error:
trans-unit.target: There are several possible causes of this error:

trans-unit.source: Some DMLs on the master server were not recorded into the binary log file.
trans-unit.target: Some DMLs on the master server were not recorded into the binary log file.

trans-unit.source: For example, SET sql_log_bin=0 is executed before the DML is executed on the master server.
trans-unit.target: For example, SET sql_log_bin=0 is executed before the DML is executed on the master server.

trans-unit.source: Before the replication role is changed to the slave server, faulty write operations are performed on it.
trans-unit.target: Before the replication role is changed to the slave server, faulty write operations are performed on it.

trans-unit.source: There are input errors for the binary log file name or offset when changing the replication role to the slave server.

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure management portal to change the replication role of the MySQL to disabled.
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure management portal to change the replication role of the MySQL to disabled.

trans-unit.source: This will put the MySQL in read-only mode.
trans-unit.target: This will put the MySQL in read-only mode.

trans-unit.source: You can then determine the cause of the error by looking at the replication error field, and resolve the issue.
trans-unit.target: You can then determine the cause of the error by looking at the replication error field, and resolve the issue.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can set a max_allowed_packet value consistent with that on the master server, and change the record on the slave server that is causing the replication failure.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can set a max_allowed_packet value consistent with that on the master server, and change the record on the slave server that is causing the replication failure.
